body: Hi @Mahathy95, I don't quite understand what the problem is. Your network trained correctly for 20k iterations, as defined, and stopped. You should be left with 4 snapshots in the dlc-models/.../train directory.

Hi @jeylau, I think the error I am getting at the stage I mentioned above is giving me an error while Checking for cross validation. This is the error I am getting after evaluation of results, when I choose to cross validate.

rename.from: CancelledError (see above for traceback): Enqueue operation was cancelled
rename.to: ValueError: array must not contain infs or NaNs

body:
hi @Mahathy95 please use the template we provide; i.e., check out how to format code for github issues please :) and see what I edited in your posts

also, you initial post is different than your new comment. The first post is 100% the normal output; you force kill at 20,000 iterations, and you have your snapshots. 

Then you evaluate. 

Then you cross-validate. These are three separate steps.... 

The only error is see is the NaN; 

But first, please tell us how your pose estimation looks, see here for how to evaluate this:
https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/maDLC_AdvUserGuide.md#evaluate-the-trained-network

Hi! Sorry for the delayed response!
I will definitely post the question in the required format from the next time! Sorry about that. 
I evaluated the network first to get those inf and nans in the output terminal. 
I included the first post as a background on the issues I was facing with the video labeling. I was able to get through evaluation results but I could see only one marker in the labelled video whereas I had plotted 6 during the labeling frames phase. 
I am not able to find the csv file in the evaluation results folder though. As for the labelled images, I am able to see a circular marker only for one of the markers I had labelled. The other markers (circular) are visible only in a few frames). The crosses are also marked for a few images and not marker for the others. 
I tried to do a single animal analysis for one of the videos and found a csv file for that but havent been able to find the csv file for any of the multi animal analysis I have done so far. Please let me know how I can do that. 
I apologize if I haven't understood the question completely... I am very new to this and would appreciate any help I can get! thanks in advance.

Hi @MMathisLab , over the weekend, I also tried to run it for 50,000 iterations with a reduced batch size of 1 since I was facing memory issues. I was able to evaluate the network to tget this result at the terminal: 
  distnorm[imageindex] = np.nanmax(lengths)
440it [03:00,  2.43it/s]
##########################################&1
Euclidean distance statistics per individual (in pixels)
                  min        max       mean        std  percentile_25  percentile_50  percentile_75
individuals
Aorta        2.283032  27.561349  10.814279  11.662634        4.25699       7.425973      13.529277
##########################################
Euclidean distance statistics per bodypart (in pixels)
                 min        max       mean  percentile_25  percentile_50  percentile_75
bodyparts
DotL        4.074864   4.074864   4.074864       4.074864       4.074864       4.074864
DotM1       9.432827   9.432827   9.432827       9.432827       9.432827       9.432827
DotM2      19.248459  19.248459  19.248459      19.248459      19.248459      19.248459
DotR        6.342722   6.342722   6.342722       6.342722       6.342722       6.342722
Ruler1     15.312230  15.312230  15.312230      15.312230      15.312230      15.312230
Ruler2     22.127945  22.127945  22.127945      22.127945      22.127945      22.127945
After this, I analysed the videos and converted to trackelts which was successfully done based on the terminal output. But when I uploaded the bx file and video under Refine tracklets tab and clicked on Launch GUI, I had an error saying tracklets are empty. I also had the same issue as above - ValueError: array must not contain infs or NaNs - while cross validating. 
My video shows decent tracking of four out of 6 markers but not bad tracking for the rest two. I was thinking about refining tracklets for these two markers. Im not sure if this is the way to go or if this is the issue? 
Thanks for your help!

issue.title: Fix calculation of edge paf lengths

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
With the default `edgewisecondition` during animal assembly, graph edge lengths in downsampled images stored during evaluation are compared to distances calculated from the labeled data (thus in full image space). This mismatch results (I believe) in no valid connections found (during `extractstrongconnections`), and in turn in no assembled animals, explaining the NaNs during crossvalidation (as the vector of statistics remains unfilled if there are no animals; https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/a9fdb5f401893dc2dc4c16a8818371215cda1ac0/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/lib/crossvalutils.py#L186-L205) and the empty tracklets.
This PR fixes distance calculation and ensures lengths are normalized by the stride. 

Fixes #1006 and possibly #949.
